settings.title: What is the HoMie VIP Day?
settings.text:
Twelve times a year since our first VIP Shopping Day in June 2015, HoMie has closed its doors to the public and invited young people connected through community support services to shop for free at the HoMie Street Store.

Each VIP shopper is welcomed into our store for a day of pampering and fun. Young people select five free items of brand-new HoMie clothing, have access to haircuts and beauty services and enjoy lunch with our friendly team.

Apart from clothing, HoMie facilitates a dignified shopping experience, increased social inclusion, and feeling of connectedness for young people affected by homelessness or hardship.

Each young person attending is a HoMie VIP. This means they are welcomed kindly, treated with respect and provided exceptional customer service.

We hope the VIPs leave HoMie feeling special and supported by HoMie and the community at large. We also hope to introduce the VIPâ€™s to the HoMie community, to create pathways into The HoMie Pathway Alliance Program.

settings.title: At HoMie, we believe in young people. We believe homelessness is a situation you can move out of with the right opportunity and support. That's why we developed the HoMie Pathway Alliance program.
About HoMie Pathway Alliance
settings.text: When HoMie started in 2015, approximately 17% of those experiencing homelessness in Melbourne were people aged 19-24. These were young people looking for work, but who were being turned away as they lacked the adequate skills, CV writing, work experiences or networks to simply 'get a job'.
The stigmas and challenges attached to homelessness also impact your opportunities and ability to get a job - don't underestimate how this would affect you confidence and wellbeing.Â

How it works:

In February each year, young people who are up to the challenge apply through partnered Community Support Services to participate in an 8-month paid retailÂ internship at the HoMie Store or a HoMie Pathway Alliance trained business.

settings.title:
By graduation in October
HoMie interns have earned:
settings.column_2_text:
Six months of paid
practical work experience
settings.column_3_text:
Eight months of
paid personal development training to build confidence and skills
settings.column_4_text: A permanent place in the Homie Alumni community

settings.title: We're so proud to support these amazing young people - check out the video below to hear more from our Pathway Alliance Alumni and their experience during the internship:

settings.text:
For HoMie's Pathway Alliance program,Â we partner with community support services and retail business to provide wrap-around support for each intern.

This ensures each young person is fully supported to follow this path to kickstart their working life - as seen below:

settings.title: Opportunities + Support + Partnerships = Pathways To Change
Here's a quick overview of the HoMie Pathway Alliance:

settings.text:
We developed our VIP Days to provide young people affected by homelessness or hardship, along with their key support worker, a day where they are treated like the VIP that they are.

HoMie VIP Days are about supporting young people, increasing social connections and having a bit of fun. VIP Days provide young people with brand new items of clothing, a fresh haircut, toiletry packs (plus optional manicures!) and lunch with the HoMie team!

Apart from clothing, HoMie's aim is to provide a dignified shopping experience, increased social inclusion, and feeling of connectedness for young Australians affected by homelessness or hardship.Â 

The best bit? It's all for free, because it's a HoMie-run initiative funded by kind people in your own community who shop at the store and align with HoMie's values.Â

settings.title: How It Works
settings.text:
Since 2015, at least twelve times a year, HoMie has closed its doors to the public and invited young people connected through community support service to shop for free at the HoMie store.Â 

If you are a community support service looking to get involved, email ellen@homie.com.au. If you are a young person affected by homelessness or hardship, ask your Key Support Worker or Youth Worker if they are partnered with HoMie.

settings.title: A Word From Services We've Worked With:
settings.quote_1_text: Inclusive, safe and friendly space. I fell that it is also worth mentioning that for some of the young people who attended, it was their first time receiving items such as deodorant and other hygiene products which was extremely valuable for the.Â  It was really beautiful to see the young people walk out of HoMie with their heads held high, a sense of confidence and massive smiles on their faces.
settings.quote_2_text: I was very impressed with teh VIP Day... the staff were so engaging with the young people and it was genuine. Well done to HoMie and all involved. I encourage there to be more social enterprises like this that encourage, support and train young people with a focus on providing positive outcomes that will make a difference in their lives.
settings.quote_3_text: Obviously the fact that everyone took home new clothes and beauty products was fantastic, but it was also great to see everyone having a genuine conversation and engaging with each other in a really positive environment. Seeing someone who had a bad week have it all changed around through a nice haircut and a whole new wardrobe was fantastic to see.Â

settings.title: Interested in being involved?
settings.text:
Are you a community support service?Â 

Please emailÂ ellen@homie.com.au

Are you a young person affected by homelessness or hardship?Â 

Ask your Key Support Worker or Youth Worker if they are partnered with HoMie.

Are you looking to volunteer / donate?Â 

You can donate directly online, or get in touch if you'd like to chat about volunteering.

At HoMie, we pride ourselves in our unique approach to support young people affected by homelessness or hardship.

We have developed programs that create pathways for young people - creating meaningful impact and outcomes is at the core of what we do for young people.

We consider ourselves a stepping stone, ready to equip them with the skills, confidence and experiences to be more work-ready and better prepared for their future.

Below weâ€™ve broken things down to help you better understand our approach in supporting young people, and our mission.

settings.title: Important things to know:
settings.column_2_text:

settings.column_3_text:

HOMELESSNESS HAS RISEN 
43% IN A DECADE

settings.title: A snapshot of our impact so far:

settings.column_1_text: Young people affected by homelessness or hardship face greater barriers to education and employment than others their age.
settings.column_2_text: We create meaningful training and employment opportunities for these young people.
settings.column_3_text:
1.Â Running two structured social impact programs

2.Â LeadingÂ AND facilitating an alliance of partners to provide positive employment opportunities

3.Â Using the HoMie clothing brand to make it â€˜cool to careâ€™
settings.column_4_text: Our graduates have the skills,Â confidence and experiences to be more work-ready andÂ better prepared for their future; and HoMie has an Alliance of retail partners who are more inclusive.

settings.text:
Creating safe employment for people affected by hardship is what we do best. It is equally important to us that the people involved in producing our clothing are afforded the same liberties.

Taking steps towards demanding greater transparency, sustainability and safer textile workplaces and practices within the fashion industry is something we are passionate about. We strive to work with manufacturers who also work towards fashion being a force for good through creating safe workplaces.

Select HoMie items are produced locally in Melbourne, manufactured using high quality cotton by the team at Qualitops and printed at Redwood Press. Our accessories (gloves, socks, beanies), are made at LMB Knitwear in Brunswick. Outside of one-off pieces, our core HoMie garments such as tees, long sleeves and hoodies are ethically produced overseas, in a factory located in the Shandong Province in China.Â 

HoMie SS21 accessories produced and supplied by Promotions Warehouse, who use Australasian Promotional Products Association (APPA) accredited suppliers. Items were ethically manufactured overseas, with HoMie branding production taking place thanks to Australian owned and run businesses. APPA ensure manufacturers have formal certification to prove they meet all international standard for various ethical practices including: No Child Labour and Exploitation, Fair Wages, Working Conditions, Sustainable Production & Environmentally Friendly Practises.

At one point in time, 100% of HoMie garments were produced in Melbourne, however in 2020 the growing nature of our enterprise has enabled us to look into other suppliers such as Maker & Co - a Sydney-based organisation with over 30 years experience in ethical production and development, working with 14 ethically approved factories.Â 

Maker & Co work closely with ethically approved offshore businesses, whose manufacturing is annually audited by SGS, the worldâ€™s leading inspection, verification, testing and certification company. Businesses and factories Maker & Co work with are ethically approved and audited annually to ensure fair working conditions.

HoMieâ€™s number one mission has always been to support young people affected by homelessness or hardship, through our impact programs and employment opportunities. Looking into alternate, ethical suppliers has allowed us to strengthen this aspect of the business while ensuring we are still producing high quality garments, with strong ethical standards.

What Does That Mean?

The audit is conducted according to the SMETA Best Practices and SMETA Measurement Criteria, including Labour standards, Health and Safety, Environment and Business Ethics and it is extended to all types of workers at the site, with union representatives present.

settings.title: Take Care â€¢ Reduce, Recycle, Upcycle

settings.text:
We are constantly learning more about sustainability and ethical end-to-end processing, and are doing everything we can to minimise waste and our overall environmental impact.

A few ways we do this include:

â€¢ Forecasting production orders based on previous sales to ensure no excess stock where possible

â€¢ If and when we have leftover stock from collections or samples, these items are used to provide brand new pieces of clothing to young people affected by homelessness, for HoMieâ€™s VIP Shopping Days. If not used for this, theyâ€™re upcycled into new, one-off garments and sold under HoMieâ€™s sub-label, REBORN.Â 

â€¢ We pack and distribute our HoMie orders using compostable postage bags thanks to the legends at Hero PackagingWe encourage consumers through our garment care labels, to look after and cherish their HoMie pieces, to ensure long-lasting wear and ultimately reducing environmental impact.

settings.title: Turning old into new - How you can do your part with HoMie:
settings.text:
Weâ€™ve partnered up with UPPAREL to turn your old textiles (things like old tees, that jumper you never wear or that much-loved long sleeve thatâ€™s seen its time) and reuse, repurpose or recycle them into something new.

The process is simple PLUS youâ€™ll get store credit with HoMie when you book a collection of old textiles.

Want to know more? Follow the link to find out more.

Book a HoMie X Upparel collection now

There are always more things to add to the list, and we will continue to strive to do our absolute best.

settings.title: What Does That Mean?
settings.text: The audit is conducted according to the SMETA Best Practices and SMETA Measurement Criteria, including Labour standards, Health and Safety, Environment and Business Ethics and it is extended to all types of workers at the site, with union representatives present.

We know that by working together, we can achieve so much more.

We value our collaborators and partners across all facets - from events, artists and product design, fundraising, training and everything in between.

HoMie believes in the power of collaboration and we wouldnâ€™t be where we are without the incredible supporters weâ€™ve worked with over the years.
Pathway Alliance Retail Partners:

Through meaningful connections and partnerships, we create wrap-around, fully supported employment opportunities for young people. Together, these partnerships become; The HoMie Pathway Alliance.

Our retail partners create a safe and welcoming work environment for HoMie interns. They provide paid training and support to young people in stores across Melbourne, and for that, we are super grateful.

settings.title: Are you interested in being a retail partner?
settings.text: Email ellen@homie.com.au

Having a safe andÂ  healthyÂ  home life has a big impact on your success at work. Thatâ€™s why we partner with community support services at an organisational level, to provide wrap-around support for our young people when theyâ€™re not at work.

Our community support services link young people into the program and provide ongoing support to HoMie and our interns throughout the internship.

settings.title: Are you interested in being a community support service partner?
settings.text: Email ellen@homie.com.au

Providing accredited education to our interns is one of the great strengths of the HoMie Pathway Alliance, and we couldnâ€™t do it without KnowledgeSpace.

HoMie has partnered with KnowledgeSpace for the last three years to develop and deliver a course that is tailored to the specific learning needs of each individual. Together, we support our interns to graduate with a Certificate III in Retail Operations.
Download our Impact Prospectus, check out our Annual ReportsÂ or reach out to us via email.
Big thank you to the team atÂ AussieÂ Broadband for providing us with brilliant high-speed internet!

Early 2015 - HoMie started out of curiosity, between 3 friends eager to break down the stigma associated with homelessness and those experiencing it rough on the streets. Starting as just a Facebook page - 'Homelessness of Melbourne' - the initiative aimed to draw awareness to the faces and stories of everyday people affected by homelessness, allowing people to share their own narrative in a dignified way, ultimately breaking down the stigma and humanising the issue.

Early 2016 - The following year, this idea grew into HoMie - 'Homelessness Of Melbourne Incorporated Enterprise' and a retail pop-up at Melbourne Central was born, with a singular monogram tee and a few other brands hanging on racks.

Late 2016 - HoMie moved from the Melbourne Central pop-up to the now flagship store at 2/296 Brunswick St, Fitzroy.

We are an organisation that supports young people affected by homelessness or hardship to equip them with skills, confidence and experiences to be more work-ready and better prepared for their future. We are gender neutral, we are socially conscious and we are a community.

Our Brunswick St store is a base for HoMie's two social impact programs - our VIP Days and a training location for our HoMie Pathway Alliance Program, as well as where we showcase our latest releases across all seasons.

From one monogram tee to year-round releases, and two solid social impact programs that have supported over 1,500 young people to date - itâ€™s fair to say the HoMie team is stoked to see how the brand has evolved over the years in making and creating impact in our community.

When you shop with HoMie, you're helping achieve our mission, to support young people affected by homelessness or hardship.
We value transparency,Â integrity, creativity and respect and we wear these values on our sleeves.

settings.title: OUR TEAM
settings.text_1:
Gregory is a Director, Cinematographer and Editor based in Melbourne, Australia.

Based at WOW Pictures between 2014-19, Gregory has led projects for a variety of clients including: Lâ€™Oreal, Maybelline, Peter Alexander, Champion, Tupperware, Specsavers, Just Jeans, TOMS, Portmans, A&D Garage Doors, Vanguard, Smiggle, Radical Yes, Peter Alexander, Rationale & HoMie.

Experienced in managing both studio and location shoots, Gregory has a wide array of experience in video production ranging from Commercial, Social, Corporate, E-Commerce, How-to, Narrative to Documentary content.
settings.text_2:
Shelbie is a Producer and Art Director based in Melbourne, Australia.

Working as Creative Producer for HoMie and HoMie Creative, she has executed projects for a range of clients within the commercial, editorial, and non-profit sector.Â With past experience working in gallery management and curation, Shelbie now leads any project management + production for HoMie Creative and manages contractor and studio bookings.

Also working as a freelance set-designer, stylist, and art director; Shelbie is experienced in wearing multiple hats within the production industry.

settings.title: The Homie Creative Team
settings.text_1:
Gregory is a Director, Cinematographer and Editor based in Melbourne, Australia.

Based at WOW Pictures between 2014-19, Gregory has led projects for a variety of clients including: Lâ€™Oreal, Maybelline, Peter Alexander, Champion, Tupperware, Specsavers, Just Jeans, TOMS, Portmans, A&D Garage Doors, Vanguard, Smiggle, Radical Yes, Peter Alexander, Rationale & HoMie.

Experienced in managing both studio and location shoots, Gregory has a wide array of experience in video production ranging from Commercial, Social, Corporate, E-Commerce, How-to, Narrative to Documentary content.

Marcus Crook is a photographer and videographer, and the Co-Founder and Creative Director of HoMie. Since the brandâ€™s inception in 2015, Marcus has led HoMieâ€™s creative team in continually creating fashion-forward, seasonal and ethical garments. An experienced photographer, videographer and designer with 10+ yearsâ€™ of experience in all things shooting, design, production and execution.

Marcus was featured in Vogues 60 names that will define the next 60 years in Australia and Generation Next - Australian creatives, disrupters, visionaries and innovators leading the way and affecting change in fashion, beauty and culture.
settings.text_2:
Tyler Mathes is a digital marketing and e-commerce consultant with over 15 yearsâ€™ of industry experience.

Tyler specialises in e-commerce strategy and operations, website development, social media marketing, search engine and email marketing.

Tylerâ€™s time in the industry has seen him work with a diverse range of businesses from start-ups to global luxury brands, such as Neuw Denim, Georg Jensen, Bang & Olufsen, HoMie, Rollaâ€™s, Henry Bucks, Vavoom, Pioneer Electronics and Abrand Jeans.

settings.title: A Label for the streets.
settings.text:
HoMie stands for Homelessness of Melbourne incorporated enterprise.

HoMie is a not-for-profit supporting young people affected by homelessness or hardship. At HoMie, we believe in young people and our aim is to empower young people to thrive.

100% of our profits go towards achieving our mission:Â 
To support young people affected by homelessness or hardship to equip them with the skills, confidence, and experiences to be more work-ready and better prepared for their future.

settings.title: What is the HoMie VIP Day?
settings.text:
Twelve times a year since our first VIP Shopping Day in June 2015, HoMie has closed its doors to the public and invited young people connected through community support services to shop for free at the HoMie Street Store.

Each VIP shopper is welcomed into our store for a day of pampering and fun. Young people select five free items of brand-new HoMie clothing, have access to haircuts and beauty services and enjoy lunch with our friendly team.

Apart from clothing, HoMie facilitates a dignified shopping experience, increased social inclusion, and feeling of connectedness for young people affected by homelessness or hardship.

Each young person attending is a HoMie VIP. This means they are welcomed kindly, treated with respect and provided exceptional customer service.

We hope the VIPs leave HoMie feeling special and supported by HoMie and the community at large. We also hope to introduce the VIPâ€™s to the HoMie community, to create pathways into The HoMie Pathway Alliance Program.

settings.title: What is the HoMie VIP Day?
settings.text:
HoMie hosts 12 VIP days per year in store between March and November each year. The VIP Days are held on Wednesdays, with the exact date to be confirmed with the service after the VIP Form is complete below. HoMie will contact you to discuss the information you have provided and offer a date for your service.

The HoMie Store is located at 296 Brunswick Street, Fitzroy. We also host an annual Rural VIP Day and VIP Pack events when the service cannot attend the VIP Day in our Fitzroy Store.

settings.title: Who does HoMie partner with?
settings.text: HoMie partners with community service organisations who work with people affected by or experiencing homelessness, housing providers, mental health services, youth justices services, AOD services and a range of different providers who support young people affected by hardship.

settings.title: How many young people come to the VIP Day?
settings.text: HoMie can host up to 20 young people from your organisation for a VIP Day.

settings.title: What can the community service partner expect from HoMie?
settings.code:
• HoMie will offer the community service partner a date for the VIP event.
  • HoMie will send all relevant information and documentation including a contract for the key contact to complete and an invite for young people attending
  • HoMie will find out any special needs of the VIPâ€™s to maximise outcomes for those attending
  • HoMie will organise food, staff and clothing to be available on the day to fit the needs of the VIPâ€™s.
  • HoMie will ensure all staff are informed about the community service partner and equipped to deliver a meaningful and safe experience.
  • HoMie will create a safe and comfortable space for VIPâ€™s and ensure smooth operations on the day to the best of our ability.

settings.title: Each young person attending is a HoMie VIP

settings.title_1: What happens after the VIP Day?
settings.text_1: The feedback from our Community service partners is extremely important to us. Before the VIP Day, HoMie will send through a feedback form to be completed on behalf of the service. We will take this feedback and use it to communicate our impact to stakeholders, funders and customers. We will also use this feedback to ensure we are providing the best service possible to young people in our community and continue to improve.
settings.title_2: Does HoMie run VIP Days outside of Melbourne?
settings.text_2: Once a year, HoMie runs a Rural VIP Day outside of Melbourne. In the past, we have partnered with services in Shepparton and Albury/Wodonga to provide young people in those areas with the HoMie VIP experience. We understand that rural areas have high levels of homelessness and are often under resourced. If you are a rural service wishing to be involved, please share your information with us in the feedback form.

settings.title: VIP Packs
settings.text:
VIP take home packs are for services or young people who cannot make it into our Fitzroy Store due to location, accessibility or other commitments. Take home VIP packs can be made up on the day of your event in store, but these must be organised before the day. Unfortunately we cannot make up VIP packs unless a young person has RSVPâ€™s to the event.

During covid lockdowns, HoMie has provided VIP Packs to services and young people in place of the in store event. We will continue to provide this service as we are impacted by lockdowns.

settings.title: Eligibility criteria
settings.code:
Young people aged 12-24
Young people identify with homelessness or hardship
Community service organisation working with this cohort
Service staff able to attend on the day
Willing to sign a contract agreement on terms of the event
Fill out a feedback survey post event
Arrange transport for young people to attend the event
Young people are able to maintain respectful relationships with all present on the day

If you meet all of the above criteria then please click the button below to complete the online application form:

HoMie VIP Day application form

Questions? Click here to contact us - we'd love to hear from you!
